intro: Senecio microalatus, commonly known as the slender senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It features slender, upright stems with narrow, gray-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Senecio microalatus produces small yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster, making it a distinctive and attractive addition to rock gardens or dry landscapes.
